user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of can_compress:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
can_compress (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  const char *ae;
  const char *de;

  ae = MHD_lookup_connection_value (con,
                                    MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                    MHD_HTTP_HEADER_ACCEPT_ENCODING);
  if (NULL == ae)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (0 == strcmp (ae,
                   "*"))
    return MHD_YES;
  de = strstr (ae,
               "deflate");
  if (NULL == de)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (((de == ae) ||
       (de[-1] == ',') ||
       (de[-1] == ' ')) &&
      ((de[strlen ("deflate")] == '\0') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ',') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ';')))
    return MHD_YES;
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function can_compress:
_MHD_EXTERN const char *
MHD_lookup_connection_value (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                             enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                             const char *key)
{
  const char *value;

  value = NULL;
  (void) MHD_lookup_connection_value_n (connection,
                                        kind,
                                        key,
                                        (NULL == key) ? 0 : strlen (key),
                                        &value,
                                        NULL);
  return value;
}
...
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_lookup_connection_value_n (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                               enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                               const char *key,
                               size_t key_size,
                               const char **value_ptr,
                               size_t *value_size_ptr)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  if (NULL == connection)
    return MHD_NO;

  if (NULL == key)
  {
    for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
    {
      if ( (0 != (kind & pos->kind)) &&
           (NULL == pos->header) )
        break;
    }
  }
  else
  {
    for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
    {
      if ( (0 != (kind & pos->kind)) &&
           (key_size == pos->header_size) &&
           ( (key == pos->header) ||
             (MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (key,
                                             pos->header,
                                             key_size) ) ) )
        break;
    }
  }

  if (NULL == pos)
    return MHD_NO;

  if (NULL != value_ptr)
    *value_ptr = pos->value;

  if (NULL != value_size_ptr)
    *value_size_ptr = pos->value_size;

  return MHD_YES;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I selected the three function definitions that form the call chain visible in the provided code: can_compress -> MHD_lookup_connection_value -> MHD_lookup_connection_value_n. Those fragments cover the only inter-function calls present in the snippets (including the call to MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ inside MHD_lookup_connection_value_n). No other functions in the provided code call can_compress, and can_compress does not call itself. The other code in the snippets consists of local string checks and calls to standard library functions (strcmp, strstr, strlen) which do not call back into application functions, so they cannot create direct or indirect recursion relevant to MISRA Rule 17.2. Therefore there are no additional fragments in the supplied code that need investigation for self-calls or indirect recursion beyond the three fragments reported. If further (omitted) function definitions exist elsewhere (for example the definition of MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_), they should be reviewed only if they are able to call back into any of the three listed functions; those definitions were not provided here.
